result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron L Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Myron L Barnes was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Myron L Barnes is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Myron L Barnes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certified Statement of Conviction of the deft
Exhibits S1 through S6, D7, D10 and D11 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 1/26/17. vm

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared (late) for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Cicchini.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:10am.  Court gives a few final instructions.  Alternate juror - Dean G.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 9:17am.  Verdict reached @ 11am.  Jurors reconvene @ 11:09am.  Deft found not guilty on counts 1 & 2.  Deft found guilty on count 3.  Jury polled.  Jurors excused @ 11:15am.  State moves to dismiss counts 1 & 2 and moves for judgment on count 3.  Defense moves for dismissal on count 3.  Deft acquitted on counts 1 & 2.  Deft adjudged guilty on count 3.  Deft admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 24mos WSP; initial confinement of 16mos WSP followed by 8mos of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft taken into custody.  Credit for 2 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.
Final
Draft No. 2
Preliminary
on Elements of Crime

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Arguments heard re: motions in limine; denied in part & granted in part.  Jurors convene @ 9:33am.  Jurors sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Opening statements given.  Testimony commences - Stephanie G.  State's exhibits #1, #2, #3, #5 & #6 - offered/received.  Defense exhibits #7, #10, & #11 - offered/received.  Jurors released @ 12:21pm; instructed to return @ 1:20pm.  Court reconvenes @ 1:38pm.  Deft wishes to testify.  Court conducts colliquey w/deft.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:46pm.  Testimony continues - P.O. David Paro.  State rests @ 1:57pm.  Defense case commences - Myron Barnes.  State's exhibit #4 offered/received.  Defense rests @ 3:37pm.  Final instructions given to jury.  Closing arguments.  Jurors released @ 4:50pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 1/19/17.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Cicchini.  Voir dire commences @ 10:16am.  Defense rest to excuse Juror Jacqueline R is denied by the Court.  Voir dire continues.  Jury selected @ 11:39am.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 11:40am.  Selected jurors released for the day @ noon; instructed to return @ 9am on 1/18/17.
